title: When is a widow not a widow?
content:
A widow IS NOT one stub end word on its own at the end of a paragraph.

Or that's what I always thought.

Typographic widows mean different things to different people. I've written a piece about my findings so far:  
 [http://www.youmayalsolike.co.uk/2014/10/when-is-widow-not-widow.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317144233/http:/www.youmayalsolike.co.uk/2014/10/when-is-widow-not-widow.html "http://www.youmayalsolike.co.uk/2014/10/when-is-widow-not-widow.html")

More interestingly, I've got a survey in which I'd love to hear your opinions:

What is a widow? TAKE THE SURVEY!  
 [http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/8NT3L8H](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317144233/http:/www.surveymonkey.com/s/8NT3L8H "http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/8NT3L8H")

Thanks nice typographic people! Please feel free to share the survey, too.
